Header.Name: PersonReconstruction
Header.Description: This is a test profile for Person reconstructions according to the PiCo model. In general terms, this means a "person" who has been already confirmed to be an existing individual.

Component.name: PersonReconstruction
Component.Documentation: A Person reconstruction is the result of modelling one or multiple PersonObservation(s) into a single resource.

Element.name: fullName
Element.Documentation: Literal name designates a full personal name. This property may only be left blank if a person's name was unknown or if a person was unnamed (e.g. a child that died shortly after being born), in which cases the property pnv:nameSpecification should state "unknown" or "unnamed". (Note -not in PiCo-: if you are entering the name of a person observation, use this element to enter the name as it appears in the source.

Element.name: givenName
Element.Documentation: A Given name designates the name(s) given to someone at birth or any other name-giving event. In the U.S., the first name of a Person.

Element.name: familyName
Element.Documentation: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of a Person.

Element.name: dateObservation
Element.Documentation: Write the date as it is written in the historical source (transcribe it; e.g., XIIII Kalend. Novembris)

Element.name: dateStart
Element.Documentation: Use this field to enter a date or the beginning of a date range (or the date if there is no date range). Select from the calendar. Adapt if necessary following this pattern: YYYY-MM-DD. If there are uncertainties, use these two uncertainty patterns (here with an example): PATTERN1: 2025-??-17 (use "?" to replace uncertain values, here the day is known to be the 17th, the year is 2025 but the month is unknown). PATTERN2: ~2025-~07 (use "~" to indicate approximate values, here it means that both the year and the month are approximate values). COMBINED example: ~2025-??-17.

Element.name: dateEnd
Element.Documentation: Use this field to enter the end date in a range. Follow the same instructions as for dateStart.

Element.name: noteDate
Element.Documentation: :Add any clarifying notes related to the dates. These notes may be for internal or external use (t.b.d.)
